title: Drawing, "Design for ink stand", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed:
Below, brown ink: No. 56181; graphite: 124f
Left center, graphite: 140f
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Rectangular base on cushion feet supports inkstand consisting of two inkpots in shell motif, lid open on right pot, pen holders on each side of fluted basin. A covered cup with a knop in shape of a wreath stands on a block, on which putti holding a pen and writing tablet, are seating on either side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ink stand", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-158.
